concept: Encryption, authentication, firewalls, and basic security principles.

challenges.title: Q1: Encryption Goal
challenges.description: The main goal of encryption in networking is to provide:
examples:
Options:
 a) Integrity only
 b) Confidentiality of data
 c) Availability only
 d) Physical security of devices

challenges.title: Q2: Firewall Role
challenges.description: A firewall in a network is used to:
examples:
Options:
 a) Increase Wi-Fi range
 b) Filter incoming and outgoing traffic based on security rules
 c) Replace all routers
 d) Provide automatic software updates

challenges.title: Q3: Authentication
challenges.description: Which of the following best describes authentication?
examples:
Options:
 a) Ensuring data has not been altered in transit
 b) Verifying the identity of a user or system
 c) Hiding data from unauthorized users
 d) Ensuring systems are always available

challenges.title: Q4: VPN Usage
challenges.description: A Virtual Private Network (VPN) is mainly used to:
examples:
Options:
 a) Increase bandwidth of the Internet connection
 b) Securely connect remote users or sites over an untrusted network
 c) Replace firewalls
 d) Compress video streams only

challenges.title: Q5: Strong Password Practice
challenges.description: Which of the following is the best example of a strong password practice?
examples:
Options:
 a) Using 'password123' for all accounts
 b) Sharing your password with friends you trust
 c) Using a long passphrase with mixed characters and not reusing across sites
 d) Writing your password on a sticky note on your monitor
